description: Make ralph.sh available as a global 'ralph' command via symlink installation

userStories.title: Fix symlink resolution for SCRIPT_DIR
userStories.description: As a developer, I want ralph.sh to correctly resolve its own directory when run via symlink, so that it can find CLAUDE.md regardless of how it's invoked
acceptanceCriteria: SCRIPT_DIR correctly resolves to the actual script location, not the symlink location
Script still works when run directly (not via symlink)

userStories.title: Update help text for ralph command
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the help text to show 'ralph' instead of 'ralph.sh', so that documentation is accurate after installation
acceptanceCriteria: Help text reflects running from any project directory

userStories.title: Create install.sh script
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to run ./install.sh to create a symlink at /usr/local/bin/ralph, so that I can use ralph from anywhere on my system
acceptanceCriteria: Symlink points to the actual ralph.sh script
Installation uses sudo if needed (prompts user)
Installation verifies success by checking if ralph is accessible
Installation is idempotent (safe to run multiple times)
Script includes --uninstall flag to remove the symlink

userStories.title: Verify end-to-end functionality
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to verify that ralph works correctly from any directory after installation, so that I can confidently use the global command
acceptanceCriteria: ralph command works from any directory
All existing flags work (--help, --max, -m, positional args)
Script correctly resolves CLAUDE.md from script directory
Script correctly uses current working directory for project files
